intro: Calcitrapa heterophylla, commonly known as the variable leaf rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its small, cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. It has a low, spreading growth habit with alternate, variable-shaped leaves that can range from linear to lobed. Calcitrapa heterophylla is known for its ability to thrive in harsh conditions, making it a hardy and resilient species.
